abstract: The Chinese e-commerce giant said Wednesday that it would pay about $250 million for 10 percent of the privatized postal system.
snippet: The Chinese e-commerce giant said Wednesday that it would pay about $250 million for 10 percent of the privatized postal system.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — The Alibaba Group, the Chinese e-commerce giant, said Wednesday that it would pay about $250 million for 10 percent of Singapore Post, the national postal system of Singapore, extending the Chinese company’s push into the logistics business and into new overseas markets.

headline.main: Alibaba to Buy Stake in Singaporean Postal System
